ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Everyone seems to be using Summon Food and Drink as the prime examples of uselessness.  Well aren t we the class that has been complaining rather loudly for
ygData.messageBody:
Everyone seems to be using Summon Food and Drink as the prime examples of
uselessness. Well aren't we the class that has been complaining rather
loudly for over a year that our forage was capped so darned low? Well
aren't we?

Warrior Greaves cast Invisibility. That's cool, but we have a song for that
guys. Think about it, we *don't* have songs that can summon food and drink.
I think it's kinda nifty, but I will admit that I hope the BP casts Gate.
:)

[51 Minstrel] Crier (Half Elf) <Seekers of Norrath> ZONE: work


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]

> Subject: RE: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions
>
>
> I'd be perfectly happy to accept the lower AC if the effects given were in
> any way in balance to those gained by the other classes. Point
> is they are
> not, in fact they patently suck.
>
> Being able to Summon Food and Water is totally a joke. It would be a joke
> if it were on armor I could get at 28th level. At 50+ it's extremely
> insulting. I'm not sure how anyone could reasonably defend that it is
> really useful to have at 50+. What do we have now, Verant
> clones? Please.
> Why would characters who have been leaving behind 5pp weapons for
> 10+ levels
> because they were trash loot suddenly care about 6cp muffins and milk?
> Great, now we can save everyone in our party 1.2 sp a day, whoopee.
>
> Enduring Breath is minorly useful. Is it anywhere near as useful
> as +25 STR
> or Invisibility is to a warrior? No.
>
> I am more irritated by the overall combo than just the AC points.
> It shows
> the usual lack of any kind of thought when it comes to the bard class. We
> aren't a tank so we get lower armor. How does this mesh with giving us a
> weapon that reduces our level on the hate list? If we aren't a tank why
> should we need a weapon to reduce hate? It certainly won't help if we
> aren't up there mixing it up.
>
> Kit
>
> snip >I think some of us are losing sight of what the bard class
> is. We're

> Guys, we're a support class not warriors remember?
